11#ifndef CALL_ADAPTATION_VIDEO_STREAM_ADAPTER_H_
12#define CALL_ADAPTATION_VIDEO_STREAM_ADAPTER_H_

18#include "absl/types/optional.h"
19#include "absl/types/variant.h"

23#include "api/video/video_stream_encoder_observer.h"
24#include "call/adaptation/adaptation_constraint.h"
25#include "call/adaptation/degradation_preference_provider.h"
26#include "call/adaptation/video_source_restrictions.h"
27#include "call/adaptation/video_stream_input_state.h"
28#include "call/adaptation/video_stream_input_state_provider.h"
29#include "modules/video_coding/utility/quality_scaler.h"

31#include "rtc_base/system/no_unique_address.h"
32#include "rtc_base/thread_annotations.h"

34namespace webrtc {
35
36// The listener is responsible for carrying out the reconfiguration of the video
37// source such that the VideoSourceRestrictions are fulfilled.
38class VideoSourceRestrictionsListener {
39 public:
40 virtual ~VideoSourceRestrictionsListener();
41
42 // The |restrictions| are filtered by degradation preference but not the
43 // |adaptation_counters|, which are currently only reported for legacy stats
44 // calculation purposes.
45 virtual void OnVideoSourceRestrictionsUpdated(
46 VideoSourceRestrictions restrictions,
47 const VideoAdaptationCounters& adaptation_counters,
48 rtc::scoped_refptr<Resource> reason,
49 const VideoSourceRestrictions& unfiltered_restrictions) = 0;
50};
51
52class VideoStreamAdapter;
53
54extern const int kMinFrameRateFps;
55
56VideoSourceRestrictions FilterRestrictionsByDegradationPreference(
57 VideoSourceRestrictions source_restrictions,
58 DegradationPreference degradation_preference);
59
60int GetLowerResolutionThan(int pixel_count);
61int GetHigherResolutionThan(int pixel_count);
62
63// Either represents the next VideoSourceRestrictions the VideoStreamAdapter
64// will take, or provides a Status code indicating the reason for not adapting
65// if the adaptation is not valid.
66class Adaptation final {
67 public:
68 enum class Status {
69 // Applying this adaptation will have an effect. All other Status codes
70 // indicate that adaptation is not possible and why.
71 kValid,
72 // Cannot adapt. The minimum or maximum adaptation has already been reached.
73 // There are no more steps to take.
74 kLimitReached,
75 // Cannot adapt. The resolution or frame rate requested by a recent
76 // adaptation has not yet been reflected in the input resolution or frame
77 // rate; adaptation is refused to avoid "double-adapting".
78 kAwaitingPreviousAdaptation,
79 // Not enough input.
80 kInsufficientInput,
81 // Adaptation disabled via degradation preference.
82 kAdaptationDisabled,
83 // Adaptation up was rejected by a VideoAdaptationConstraint.
84 kRejectedByConstraint,
85 };
86
87 static const char* StatusToString(Status status);
88
89 Status status() const;
90 const VideoStreamInputState& input_state() const;
91 const VideoSourceRestrictions& restrictions() const;
92 const VideoAdaptationCounters& counters() const;
93
94 private:
95 friend class VideoStreamAdapter;
96
97 // Constructs with a valid adaptation. Status is kValid.
98 Adaptation(int validation_id,
99 VideoSourceRestrictions restrictions,
100 VideoAdaptationCounters counters,
101 VideoStreamInputState input_state);
102 // Constructor when adaptation is not valid. Status MUST NOT be kValid.
103 Adaptation(int validation_id, Status invalid_status);
104
105 // An Adaptation can become invalidated if the state of VideoStreamAdapter is
106 // modified before the Adaptation is applied. To guard against this, this ID
107 // has to match VideoStreamAdapter::adaptation_validation_id_ when applied.
108 // TODO(https://crbug.com/webrtc/11700): Remove the validation_id_.
109 const int validation_id_;
110 const Status status_;
111 // Input state when adaptation was made.
112 const VideoStreamInputState input_state_;
113 const VideoSourceRestrictions restrictions_;
114 const VideoAdaptationCounters counters_;
115};
116
117// Owns the VideoSourceRestriction for a single stream and is responsible for
118// adapting it up or down when told to do so. This class serves the following
119// purposes:
120// 1. Keep track of a stream's restrictions.
121// 2. Provide valid ways to adapt up or down the stream's restrictions.
122// 3. Modify the stream's restrictions in one of the valid ways.
123class VideoStreamAdapter {
124 public:
125 VideoStreamAdapter(VideoStreamInputStateProvider* input_state_provider,
126 VideoStreamEncoderObserver* encoder_stats_observer);
127 ~VideoStreamAdapter();
128
129 VideoSourceRestrictions source_restrictions() const;
130 const VideoAdaptationCounters& adaptation_counters() const;
131 void ClearRestrictions();
132
133 void AddRestrictionsListener(
134 VideoSourceRestrictionsListener* restrictions_listener);
135 void RemoveRestrictionsListener(
136 VideoSourceRestrictionsListener* restrictions_listener);
137 void AddAdaptationConstraint(AdaptationConstraint* adaptation_constraint);
138 void RemoveAdaptationConstraint(AdaptationConstraint* adaptation_constraint);
139
140 // TODO(hbos): Setting the degradation preference should not clear
141 // restrictions! This is not defined in the spec and is unexpected, there is a
142 // tiny risk that people would discover and rely on this behavior.
143 void SetDegradationPreference(DegradationPreference degradation_preference);
144
145 // Returns an adaptation that we are guaranteed to be able to apply, or a
146 // status code indicating the reason why we cannot adapt.
147 Adaptation GetAdaptationUp();
148 Adaptation GetAdaptationDown();
149 Adaptation GetAdaptationTo(const VideoAdaptationCounters& counters,
150 const VideoSourceRestrictions& restrictions);
151 // Tries to adapt the resolution one step. This is used for initial frame
152 // dropping. Does nothing if the degradation preference is not BALANCED or
153 // MAINTAIN_FRAMERATE. In the case of BALANCED, it will try twice to reduce
154 // the resolution. If it fails twice it gives up.
155 Adaptation GetAdaptDownResolution();
156
157 // Updates source_restrictions() the Adaptation.
158 void ApplyAdaptation(const Adaptation& adaptation,
159 rtc::scoped_refptr<Resource> resource);
160
161 struct RestrictionsWithCounters {
162 VideoSourceRestrictions restrictions;
163 VideoAdaptationCounters counters;
164 };
165
166 static absl::optional<uint32_t> GetSingleActiveLayerPixels(
167 const VideoCodec& codec);
168
169 private:
170 void BroadcastVideoRestrictionsUpdate(
171 const VideoStreamInputState& input_state,
172 const rtc::scoped_refptr<Resource>& resource);
173
174 bool HasSufficientInputForAdaptation(const VideoStreamInputState& input_state)
175 const RTC_RUN_ON(&sequence_checker_);
176
177 using RestrictionsOrState =
178 absl::variant<RestrictionsWithCounters, Adaptation::Status>;
179 RestrictionsOrState GetAdaptationUpStep(
180 const VideoStreamInputState& input_state) const
181 RTC_RUN_ON(&sequence_checker_);
182 RestrictionsOrState GetAdaptationDownStep(
183 const VideoStreamInputState& input_state,
184 const RestrictionsWithCounters& current_restrictions) const
185 RTC_RUN_ON(&sequence_checker_);
186 RestrictionsOrState GetAdaptDownResolutionStepForBalanced(
187 const VideoStreamInputState& input_state) const
188 RTC_RUN_ON(&sequence_checker_);
189 RestrictionsOrState AdaptIfFpsDiffInsufficient(
190 const VideoStreamInputState& input_state,
191 const RestrictionsWithCounters& restrictions) const
192 RTC_RUN_ON(&sequence_checker_);
193
194 Adaptation GetAdaptationUp(const VideoStreamInputState& input_state) const
195 RTC_RUN_ON(&sequence_checker_);
196 Adaptation GetAdaptationDown(const VideoStreamInputState& input_state) const
197 RTC_RUN_ON(&sequence_checker_);
198
199 static RestrictionsOrState DecreaseResolution(
200 const VideoStreamInputState& input_state,
201 const RestrictionsWithCounters& current_restrictions);
202 static RestrictionsOrState IncreaseResolution(
203 const VideoStreamInputState& input_state,
204 const RestrictionsWithCounters& current_restrictions);
205 // Framerate methods are member functions because they need internal state
206 // if the degradation preference is BALANCED.
207 RestrictionsOrState DecreaseFramerate(
208 const VideoStreamInputState& input_state,
209 const RestrictionsWithCounters& current_restrictions) const
210 RTC_RUN_ON(&sequence_checker_);
211 RestrictionsOrState IncreaseFramerate(
212 const VideoStreamInputState& input_state,
213 const RestrictionsWithCounters& current_restrictions) const
214 RTC_RUN_ON(&sequence_checker_);
215
216 struct RestrictionsOrStateVisitor;
217 Adaptation RestrictionsOrStateToAdaptation(
218 RestrictionsOrState step_or_state,
219 const VideoStreamInputState& input_state) const
220 RTC_RUN_ON(&sequence_checker_);
221
222 RTC_NO_UNIQUE_ADDRESS SequenceChecker sequence_checker_
223 RTC_GUARDED_BY(&sequence_checker_);
224 // Gets the input state which is the basis of all adaptations.
225 // Thread safe.
226 VideoStreamInputStateProvider* input_state_provider_;
227 // Used to signal when min pixel limit has been reached.
228 VideoStreamEncoderObserver* const encoder_stats_observer_;
229 // Decides the next adaptation target in DegradationPreference::BALANCED.
230 const BalancedDegradationSettings balanced_settings_;
231 // To guard against applying adaptations that have become invalidated, an
232 // Adaptation that is applied has to have a matching validation ID.
233 int adaptation_validation_id_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(&sequence_checker_);
234 // When deciding the next target up or down, different strategies are used
235 // depending on the DegradationPreference.
236 // https://w3c.github.io/mst-content-hint/#dom-rtcdegradationpreference
237 DegradationPreference degradation_preference_
238 RTC_GUARDED_BY(&sequence_checker_);
239 // Used to avoid adapting twice. Stores the resolution at the time of the last
240 // adaptation.
241 // TODO(hbos): Can we implement a more general "cooldown" mechanism of
242 // resources intead? If we already have adapted it seems like we should wait
243 // a while before adapting again, so that we are not acting on usage
244 // measurements that are made obsolete/unreliable by an "ongoing" adaptation.
245 struct AwaitingFrameSizeChange {
246 AwaitingFrameSizeChange(bool pixels_increased, int frame_size);
247 const bool pixels_increased;
248 const int frame_size_pixels;
249 };
250 absl::optional<AwaitingFrameSizeChange> awaiting_frame_size_change_
251 RTC_GUARDED_BY(&sequence_checker_);
252 // The previous restrictions value. Starts as unrestricted.
253 VideoSourceRestrictions last_video_source_restrictions_
254 RTC_GUARDED_BY(&sequence_checker_);
255 VideoSourceRestrictions last_filtered_restrictions_
256 RTC_GUARDED_BY(&sequence_checker_);
257
258 std::vector<VideoSourceRestrictionsListener*> restrictions_listeners_
259 RTC_GUARDED_BY(&sequence_checker_);
260 std::vector<AdaptationConstraint*> adaptation_constraints_
261 RTC_GUARDED_BY(&sequence_checker_);
262
263 RestrictionsWithCounters current_restrictions_
264 RTC_GUARDED_BY(&sequence_checker_);
265};
266
267} // namespace webrtc
268
269#endif // CALL_ADAPTATION_VIDEO_STREAM_ADAPTER_H_
